title.rendered: South Africa vs England, 1st ODI, 2023: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Team

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

South Africa: Quinton de Kock (wk), Temba Bavuma (c), Aiden Markram, Rassie van der Dussen, David Miller, Marco Jansen, Wayne Parnell, Keshav Maharaj, Kagiso Rabada, Anrich Nortje, Tabraiz Shamsi

England: Jos Buttler (c & wk), Jason Roy, Philip Salt, Dawid Malan, Harry Brook, Moeen Ali, Sam Curran, Chris Woakes, Adil Rashid, Jofra Archer, Reece Topley

Venue: Mangaung Oval, Bloemfontein

Pitch Report

(Based on the last 3 games)

1st innings average score: 289

2nd innings average score: 242

Wickets per innings: 8

Type: Good batting wicket

Wins

Batting 1st: 67%

Batting 2nd: 33%

Fantasy Tips of The Day

Quinton de Kock loves batting against England. He has accumulated 834 runs at 64 including 3 centuries and 4 fifties. Furthermore, when he last batted against them at Bloemfontein, he smashed 138 off 96.

Kagiso Rabada has experienced a fruitful time against England. In 8 games, he has bagged 18 wickets, including the best figures of 4 for 19.

Likewise, Reece Topley has tasted decent success against South Africa. He has taken 12 wickets in 7 attempts. He has also been a part of the Ultimate Team in 4 of his last 5 ODIs.

Although Jos Buttler averages 31 against South Africa, he will have fond memories of returning to Bloemfontein, where he slammed 105 against the Proteas in 2016.

Jason Roy doesn’t have great numbers against South Africa. In 15 innings, he has managed only 273 runs, including 5 dismissals in the single digits.

Lately, Temba Bavuma has been a major disappointment in fantasy leagues. He averages a mere 17 in his last 5 ODIs.

As many as 3 hundreds and 8 fifties have been registered at the venue in the last 3 games.

1 / 5 ( 2 votes )
